node.title: 'The first case but not the last': Tasmania records COVID-19 infection after opening borders
node.alt: Tasmanian Premier Peter Gutwein in a suit gestures at a press conference podium in front of a "Keep on top of COVID" sign.
node.description: One of the first travellers to enter Tasmania yesterday after borders reopened to hotspots has tested positive to COVID-19, with Premier Peter Gutwein saying the health system is working.
node.content:
["Tasmania has recorded its first case of COVID-19 since the state opened its borders to the rest of the country yesterday.", "Premier Peter Gutwein said a man in his 20s, who arrived in Hobart from New South Wales on one of the early morning flights yesterday, has tested positive.", "Mr Gutwein said the man was an approved traveller who had met all the necessary vaccination and pre-testing requirements, having received a negative COVID test prior to his departure.", "\"After arrival, he was notified by New South Wales Health and informed that he was a close contact of a case in New South Wales,\"\u00a0he said.", "\"He went and took a test and returned a positive test last evening.\"", "Mr Gutwein said the man was now isolating at his residence and being managed by Public Health.", "\"It's understandable that some people will be concerned,\" he said.", "\"However what this demonstrates is that the system works and we'll continue to follow the plan that we have laid out and, importantly, the advice of Public Health.\"", "Public Health director Mark Veitch said he was advised by the contract tracing team about the positive case about 8pm last night.", "\"Around the time of their arrival they reported being alerted by New South Wales Health they were a contact because they had been at a hospitality venue in Newcastle last weekend where there was significant transmission of coronavirus,\" he said.", "\"Upon receiving that information, they travelled into the city, they picked up a car in town and travelled out to the show grounds where they were tested.\"", "
Variant not yet known
", "Dr Veitch said authorities would not know if it was an Omicron case until further testing had been conducted,\u00a0likely tomorrow or Saturday.", "\"In the meantime, we are managing this case as if they do have the Omicron strain,\" he said.", "He said the taxi driver who took the man and their family member into the city has been identified and is in quarantine.", "The family member who travelled with this person is also in quarantine.", "
19 close contacts on plane
", "Dr Veitch said there were 97 people on Qantas flight QF1533. Nineteen\u00a0of those have been identified as close contacts.", "They were the people who sat in the same row as the case and those who sat in the two rows in front or behind.", "\"They've all been contacted by SMS and they're currently being interviewed by and contacted by Public Health,\" Dr Veitch said.", "\"The advice to them is they are close contacts and they'll be required to quarantine for seven days.", "They'll have a test at the start of their quarantine period and end of their quarantine period.\"", "Anyone on the plane who was not vaccinated, which Dr Veitch said would most likely only apply to children, will need to quarantine for 14 days.", "The remaining people on the plane are casual contacts and will need to get tested on day three and day five.", "
Airport a low-risk exposure site
", "The airport has been defined as a low-risk exposure site\u00a0between 8:30am and 9:00am.\u00a0", "\"That means that people who were at the airport at that time are asked to monitor for symptoms, and if they get any symptoms to get tested,\" Dr Veitch said.", "\"We'll also be sending SMS messages out to people who checked into the airport at that time.\"", "Dr Veitch said the case represented\u00a0a situation where the system was working.", "\"The person being a contact at an exposure in New South Wales was at much higher risk of having COVID than the average person coming in from Sydney or from New South Wales or Victoria,\" he said.", "\"Their exposure to members of the public was very limited in Tasmania. It's my hope and expectation that this case is managed neatly without any establishment of community transmission.\""]
